data.title: Countries that use the Guyana dollar
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Guyana dollar. Convert GYD to any other currency.
data.text:
The Guyana dollar was established in 1975 as an official national currency and is used only in Guyana. It replaced the previously valid pound sterling. 1 Dollar is devided into 100 Cents.

ISO 4127:

GYD

Numeric:

328

Symbol:

$

List of all currencies

Overview: Guyana

1.00 Guyana dollars = 0.0048 US dollars

(Date: 08/16/2024)

Currency:

Convert to:

Amount:

↔ Reverse currencies

Exchange rate history 1000 GYD in USD

The graph shown here shows the exchange rate development from January 2018 to March 2024. The exchange rate for 1000 GYD moved during this time from USD 4.87 to USD 4.76. In these 74 months it fell by 2.2 percent.

› Inflation development in Guyana

Currency reserves for the Guyana dollar

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to GYD 1.033 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 186.66 billion dollars. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:5.5. In other words, not even 1 of 5 dollars is deposited with a countervalue.

Approximately 4.60 billion dollars (2.5%) of the currency reserves exist in gold reserves. The remainder consists of foreign currencies, special drawing rights in the International Monetary Fund and other reserve positions.

› Worldwide currency and gold reserves

Sources

All conversion rates are based on data from the European Central Bank.

Data on currency and gold reserves are from the International Monetary Fund.
